title: Installing Java Environment on Linux
content:
Installing Java Environment on Linux
JDK is the software development kit for the Java language, and it is the core of Java development. It includes the Java runtime environment (JVM + Java system libraries) and Java development tools.
This article will install Java 19 on CentOS7.
3.1 JDK Download


Search for Java in Baidu, then click to enter the Java | Oracle official website (make sure not to click the wrong one).



Click on Developer Resources in the top menu of the official website.



Click on Download at the top of the new page.



On the new page, click Download Java at Oracle.com.



Scroll down to find Java19, select the Linux version (if you are using a different operating system, please select the corresponding version), find x64 RPM Package, and copy the download link on the right.



Open the terminal on Linux or connect to Linux via SSH.



Use the wget command to download the package. If you don’t have wget, use the following command to install it.
Ubuntu
apt-get install wget
CentOS
yum install wget



3.2 JDK Installation


Use the rpm command to install Java.
rpm -ivh [filename]

-i     means install, which installs the software.
-v   displays detailed information during the installation process.
-h    shows the installation progress with # symbols.




You can use it directly next.



3.3 JDK Uninstallation


Use the rpm command to uninstall the package.
rpm -e jdk-19

title: Installing VMware Virtual Machine
content:
Installing VMware Virtual Machine


Search for vmware on baidu and enter the VMware official website.



Find Resources in the upper right corner.



Scroll down to find Product Downloads.



Enter vmware workstation pro 16 in the search box and click the search icon.



Click the second result, as the first is for Linux and the second is for Windows. Note that the official website’s labeling may not be clear.



After clicking, you will see the installer in the file list. Click Download Now to download.

Downloading from the official website requires logging in. Here, I provide a backup link.


The downloaded file is a .exe file. Double-click to install.



Next.



Accept the license agreement.



If you have installed Hyper-V, you will see this option. To ensure compatibility, check Automatically install WHP.



Do not change anything in this step. Click Next.



It is recommended to uncheck both options.



Next.



Install.




After installation, click Finish.



Activating the Software


Open VMware Workstation.



Select I have a license key for VMware Workstation 16 and enter your purchased key, then click Continue to activate.

title: Installing Windows 7 in a VMware Virtual Machine
content:
Installing Windows 7 in a VMware Virtual Machine
1. Installing VMware Virtual Machine

Reference: Installing VMware Virtual Machine

2. Creating the Virtual Machine


Click Create a New Virtual Machine on the main interface.



Select Typical, then click Next.



Here, we choose Install the operating system later. If we selected the system image here, VMware would automatically complete the system deployment for us. However, the system would be in poor condition after deployment, so we will manually deploy it.



Select Windows 7 for the operating system.



Set the name and storage location for the virtual machine. It is strongly recommended to place the virtual machine in a disk other than the C drive.



Enter the disk capacity based on your needs. Generally, it should not be less than 20GB to reserve space for the system.



Click Customize Hardware at this step.



Find the New CD/DVD option, click Use ISO image file, and then select your ISO image file. Here is the download link for Windows 7 64-bit Professional with sp1 Batch Version. It is recommended to use Xunlei for downloading (make sure to select the version with vl, otherwise activation will be a nightmare).
ed2k://|file|cn_windows_7_professional_with_sp1_vl_build_x64_dvd_u_677816.iso|3266004992|5A52F4CCEFA71797D58389B397038B2F|/



For the Network Adapter, it is recommended to change it to Bridged Mode. However, it won’t affect usage if you don’t change it.



After closing the Hardware Settings page, click Finish.



Go to the newly created virtual machine and click Power on this virtual machine.



Wait for the virtual machine to start.



2. Installing the Operating System


Select the language you understand, then click Next – Install Now.




Accept the license terms.



Choose Custom (Advanced).



On the disk selection page, click Drive Options (Advanced) (A).



Select the unallocated disk, then click New – Apply – OK.





Click Next, and the system will install automatically. You can use this time to enjoy a coffee.




After several restarts, the virtual machine will enter the system setup page. Set a username you like, then click Next all the way through. You can choose to set or not set a password. Updates will be discussed later; just follow the images for the rest.








Enter the operating system.



3. Installing VMware Tools


Click Virtual Machine – Install VMware Tools in the menu bar.



If autoplay prompts a window, click Run. If no window pops up, find the DVD drive in the computer and double-click it.




During the installation process, just click Next all the way through.






If there are driver issues, select Always install this driver software.



If you encounter the following error, refer to “Solving Windows 7 VMware Tools Installation Errors”.



After installation, restart the system once.




The benefit of installing VMware Tools is that the resolution can adapt automatically, and you can directly drag and drop files into the virtual machine.

title: Usage of Java's if Branch Statement
content:
I. Branch Structures
1.1 if Statement
1.1.1 Single Branch Structure
if(conditional expression){    statement sequence}
The execution process is shown in the figure below:

1.1.2 Double Branch Structure
if(conditional expression){    statement sequence 1}else{    statement sequence 2}
The execution process is shown in the figure below:

1.1.3 Multiple Branch Structure
if(conditional expression 1){    statement sequence 1}else if（conditional expression 2）{    statement sequence 2}  ...else if(conditional expression n){    statement sequence n}else {    statement sequence n+1}
The execution process is shown in the figure below:

Practice


Input a year from the keyboard and output the number of days in that year.
This question mainly involves the knowledge of leap year determination.

Leap years are generally multiples of 4, but not multiples of 100, or multiples of 400.

import java.util.Scanner;public class runnian {    public static void main(String[] args){        Scanner year = new Scanner(System.in);        int y = year.nextInt();        if((y%4==0 && y%100 != 0) || y%400 == 0){            //System.out.println("Leap year");            System.out.println(366);        }        else{            //System.out.println("Common year");            System.out.println(365);        }    }}/* Input2000*//* Output366


Read three numbers from the keyboard and output the largest number.
import java.util.Scanner;public class zuidashu {    public static void main(String[] args) {        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);        int a1 = scan.nextInt();        int a2 = scan.nextInt();        int a3 = scan.nextInt();        int max;        if (a1 < a2) {            max = a2;        } else {            max = a1;        }        if (max < a3) {            max = a3;        }        System.out.println(max);    }}/* Input10 20 30*//* Output30*/


Input your Java course exam score and output the corresponding grade evaluation. (90 and above is excellent, 80 to 89 is good, 70 to 79 is average, 60 to 69 is pass, below 60 is fail)
import java.util.Scanner;public class chengji {    public static void main(String[] args) {        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);        int score = scan.nextInt();        if (score >= 90) {            System.out.println("Excellent");        } else if (score >= 80) {            System.out.println("Good");        } else if (score >= 70) {            System.out.println("Average");        } else if (score >= 60) {            System.out.println("Pass");        } else {            System.out.println("Fail");        }    }}/* Input90*//* OutputExcellent*/


1.2 switch Statement
1.2.1 Multiway Branch
Java also defines the switch statement to implement multiway branches.
Its syntax structure is as follows:
switch (expression) {  case value1:    statement sequence1;    // When the result of expression matches value1, execute the statements here    [break;]  case value2:    statement sequence2;    // When the result of expression matches value2, execute the statements here    [break;]  ...  case valueN:    statement sequencen;    // When the result of expression matches valueN, execute the statements here    [break;]  default:    statement sequencen+1;  // If the expression does not match the above value, execute the statements here}
The execution flow is shown in the figure below:

1.2.2 Syntax Rules
The switch case statement has the following rules:

The type of the result of the expression in the switch statement can be: byte, short, int, or char. Starting from JDK1.5, it supports enum, and starting from Java SE 7, it supports the String type.
The switch statement can have multiple case statements. Each case is followed by a value to compare and a colon.
The data type of the value in the case statement must be the same as the data type of the expression result, and it can only be a constant or a literal constant.
When the value of the expression matches the value of the case statement, the statements after the case statement begin to execute, and the switch statement is exited only when a break statement appears.
When a break statement is encountered, the switch statement terminates. The program jumps to the statements after the switch statement to execute. The break statement in the case statement is optional. If there is no break statement, the program will continue to execute the next case statement until a break statement appears or the switch statement completes execution.
The switch statement can include a default branch, which is usually the last branch of the switch statement (it can be in any position, but it is recommended to be the last). The default executes when the value of the case statement does not match the value of the expression. The default branch does not require a break statement.

Practice
Use the switch statement to determine the operator entered by the user from the keyboard, and then output the result after the calculation.
import java.util.Scanner;public class jisuan {    public static void main(String[] args) {        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);        String symbol = scan.next();        int a = 10;        int b = 20;        switch (symbol){            case "+":                System.out.println(a+b);                break;            case "-":                System.out.println(a-b);                break;            case "*":                System.out.println(a*b);                break;            case "/":                System.out.println(a/b);                break;            default:                System.out.println("Not enough for arithmetic operations?");                break;        }    }}/* Input+*//* Output30*/
Input a month from the keyboard, and then determine the number of days in that month.
import java.util.Scanner;public class yuefen {    public static void main(String[] args) {        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);        int month = scan.nextInt();        switch (month) {            case 1:            case 3:            case 5:            case 7:            case 8:            case 10:            case 12:                System.out.println(31);                break;            case 4:            case 6:            case 9:            case 11:                System.out.println(30);                break;            case 2:                System.out.println(28);                break;            default:                System.out.println("Does your year have"+month+"months?");                break;        }    }}/* Input12*//* Output31*/

title: Overview of Java Language
content:
Overview of Java Language
1.1 Brief History

Introduced by SUN in 1995.
JDK1.0 released in 1996.
In 1999, Java was divided into J2SE, J2EE, and J2ME, with JSP/Servlet technology emerging.
In 2004, a milestone version was released: JDK1.5, which was renamed to JDK5.0 to highlight its importance.
In 2005, J2SE was renamed to JavaSE, J2EE was renamed to JavaEE, and J2ME was renamed to JavaME.
In 2009, Oracle acquired SUN.
In 2014, JDK8.0 (jdk1.8) was released, the most significant version since JDK5.0, and is currently the mainstream version in the market.
The latest version as of now is Java19.

Java has become the preferred development language for web application development and is widely used in JavaEE, big data, and Android development.
1.2 Java’s Technical Architecture


JavaSE
Supports Java platforms for desktop applications (e.g., applications on Windows), providing a complete Java core API. This version was previously known as J2SE.


JavaEE
A suite of solutions for developing applications in enterprise environments. The technologies included in this architecture, such as Servlet and JSP, are primarily targeted at web application development. This version was previously known as J2EE.


JavaME
Supports Java programs running on mobile devices (phones, PDAs), with some simplification of the Java API and the addition of support for mobile devices. This version was previously known as J2ME. It is now largely replaced by Android.
JavaSE is the core part of the three platforms, and both JavaEE and JavaME have evolved from JavaSE.


1.3 Features of the Java Language


Simplicity and Ease of Learning
Similar in syntax to C, it was developed based on C and C++. Java explicitly removed features like pointers that are difficult to master in C and C++, and introduced a garbage collection mechanism to reclaim memory space occupied by objects that are no longer referenced.


Purely Object-Oriented
An object-oriented programming language centered around objects and driven by messages.


Platform Independence and Good Portability
Programs written in Java can run on different hardware and software platforms without modification.


Distributed
Supports the development of Internet applications, with built-in network application programming interfaces and a rich set of network programming classes.


Security
Built-in security mechanisms to prevent attacks from malicious code.


Reliability
Strong type system, exception handling, automatic garbage collection, etc.


Native Support for Multithreading
The Java runtime environment itself is multithreaded, and the Java language also provides the Thread class and its subclasses, greatly simplifying the development of multithreaded applications.


Coexistence of Compilation and Interpretation
There are two common ways to translate high-level languages into machine instructions: compilation and interpretation.
Compilation: The high-level language source program is first translated into an object program by a compiler, and the object program is then executed.
Interpretation: While running the high-level language source program, an interpreter translates and executes the source program on the fly.
Java does not compile source files (.java files) into machine code but compiles them into a platform-independent bytecode file (.class file). Bytecode files can be interpreted and executed in any platform’s JVM.

title: Detailed Explanation of the "Little Fish Swimming" Problem
content:
Problem Analysis
On this day, Little Fish made precise timing of its swimming time and found that it swam from a time of b minutes to a time of c time of d minutes on the same day. Please help Little Fish calculate how long it swam in total that day.
The key to the problem lies in unifying units.
Unify units to minutes: a hours and b minutes is a * 60 + b minutes. c hours and d minutes is c * 60 + d minutes. The time difference is the difference between the two minutes. Then convert it to hours and minutes.
Conventional Approach
Step 1: Input Time
Use the input command to input the input time, separately input hours and minutes.
a = input('Please enter the starting hour (24-hour format):')b = input('Please enter the starting minutes (24-hour format):')c = input('Please enter the ending hour (24-hour format):')d = input('Please enter the ending minutes (24-hour format):')
Step 2: Time Conversion
Convert hours to minutes by multiplying by 60 and adding the input minutes.
e = int(a) * 60 + int(b)f = int(c) * 60 + int(d)
Step 3: Time Calculation
Subtract the starting time (minutes) from the ending time (minutes) to calculate the total duration.
g = f - e
Step 4: Convert to Hour Format
Divide the total minutes by 60 to get the integer part, and the remainder is the remaining minutes.
h = g // 60i = g % 60
Step 5: Output
Remember to convert the string.
print('Total swimming time: ' + str(h) + ' hours ' + str(i) + ' minutes')
Code Example
a = input('Please enter the starting hour (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inputb = input('Please enter the starting minutes (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inputc = input('Please enter the ending hour (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inputd = input('Please enter the ending minutes (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inpute = int(a) * 60 + int(b)   #Convert the starting hours to minutes and add the starting minutesf = int(c) * 60 + int(d)   #Convert the ending hours to minutes and add the ending minutesg = f - e   #Total minutes subtraction to calculate swimming timeh = g // 60   #Integer division to get hoursi = g % 60   #Remainder to get minutesprint('Total swimming time: ' + str(h) + ' hours ' + str(i) + ' minutes')   #String output
Partial Code Explanation
【//】 is integer division, 【%】 is the remainder
Integer division is to perform division, and only the integer part is retained. The remainder is what you learned in elementary school ↓

Borrowing Method (Not Recommended)
For example: The starting time is 6:30, and the ending time is 7:20. Normally, we can calculate the time in our heads as 50 minutes. In the computer, you need to split the hours and minutes to calculate, i.e., “ending hours - starting hours” “ending minutes - starting minutes”, here also involves a judgment condition, just like the example I gave, the ending minutes are smaller than the starting minutes, so the subtraction will result in a negative number, at this time we need to borrow 1 from the hours and then perform the operation.
Step 1: Input Time
Use the input command to input the input time, separately input hours and minutes.
a = input('Please enter the starting hour (24-hour format):')b = input('Please enter the starting minutes (24-hour format):')c = input('Please enter the ending hour (24-hour format):')d = input('Please enter the ending minutes (24-hour format):')
Step 2: Minute Size Judgment
If the ending minutes are greater than the starting minutes, there is no need to borrow, otherwise you need to borrow. First use if to judge, if d < b i.e., the ending minutes are less than the starting minutes, then……
The code is in the next step.
Step 3: Borrowing Operation
In the hours, subtract the ending time from the starting time and subtract 1. In the minutes, because you have borrowed 1, add 60 (one hour is 60 minutes) to the ending minutes, and then subtract the ending minutes to avoid negative numbers.
Remember to output.

if d<b:    e = int(c) - int(a) - 1    f = (60 + int(b)) - int(d)    print('Total swimming time: ' + str(e) + ' hours ' + str(f) + ' minutes')
Step 4: Non-Borrowing Operation
If d is greater than b, i.e., the ending minutes are greater than the starting minutes, then direct subtraction can be used here. You need to use else, i.e., otherwise……
You also need to output:
else:    g = int(c) - int(a)    f = int(d) - int(b)    print('Total swimming time: ' + str(g) + ' hours ' + str(f) + ' minutes')
Code Example
a = input('Please enter the starting hour (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inputb = input('Please enter the starting minutes (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inputc = input('Please enter the ending hour (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inputd = input('Please enter the ending minutes (24-hour format):')   #Waiting for inputif d<b:   #if for state judgment, if    e = int(c) - int(a) - 1   #operation process, convert input to integer    f = (60 + int(b)) - int(d)   #operation process, convert input to integer    print('Total swimming time: ' + str(e) + ' hours ' + str(f) + ' minutes')   #output result, convert number to stringelse:   #Included in the if judgment, otherwise    g = int(c) - int(a)   #operation process, convert input to integer    f = int(d) - int(b)   #operation process, convert input to integer    print('Total swimming time: ' + str(g) + ' hours ' + str(f) + ' minutes')   #output result, convert number to string
Partial Code Explanation
if statement has not been learned yet, it will be learned later, and the general usage is something like this, detailed please see comments.

title: Usage of Scanner in Java Programming
content:
Usage of Scanner
JavaSE provides a class named Scanner in the java.util package, specifically designed for input operations. You can use this class to create an object and then utilize its methods to read data from the keyboard.
Specific implementation steps:

Import the package import java.util.Scanner;
Instantiation of Scanner (creating an object of the class)
Use the Scanner’s next() method to obtain input content of a specified type

Scanner does not have a specific next() method for obtaining char type data. However, it provides next() and nextLine() for obtaining strings. If you want to obtain character data, you can first get a string and then perform character extraction operations on the string.



Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);// Get stringSystem.out.println("Please enter your name:");String name = scan.next();// Get integerSystem.out.println("Please enter your age:");int age = scan.nextInt();// Get double precision floating pointSystem.out.println("Please enter your height (in meters):");double height = scan.nextDouble();// Get boolean typeSystem.out.println("Do you like learning Java:");boolean isLove = scan.nextBoolean();System.out.println("Your information is:");System.out.println("Name：" + name);System.out.println("Age：" + age);System.out.println("Height：" + height);System.out.println("Like Java：" + isLove);
Classic A+B Problem

Input two integers a, b, and output their sum.

import java.io.*;import java.util.*;public class Main {    public static void main(String args[]) throws Exception {        Scanner cin=new Scanner(System.in);        int a = cin.nextInt(), b = cin.nextInt();        System.out.println(a+b);    }}

title: Minecraft Java Edition Original Server Setup Guide
content:
Introduction
Back when I first started playing Minecraft, I only played in single-player worlds. Later, I learned to play with classmates in multiplayer mode, but every time we had to be on the same local network.
Later, I came across an app called “Minecraft Multiplayer Box,” which allowed me to join a server for the first time.
After that, I had an idea: to set up my own server to play on.
Note: This tutorial is only applicable to Mojang's official version of Minecraft. NetEase version cannot join this server.
Official Server
The purest and fastest-updated server, offering an authentic gaming experience without mods or plugins.
Server Configuration Guide
Windows

Ensure Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is installed on your computer or server. Follow the specific tutorial below:


Windows: Portal

It is highly recommended to install Java 17 or later for the latest server version. If your Java version is too low, it may fail to start properly.

Search for minecraft on Baidu and visit the Official Website | Minecraft. Do not enter the Chinese version of the website.



Scroll down to the bottom of the page and find Support — Download.



Scroll down to find Experience Different Versions of MINECRAFT — Server Software — Java Edition Server.



On this page, the official provides the download link and usage instructions. Click the blue text to download. The official command is just a reference, so you need to modify it flexibly.

  java -Xmx1024M -Xms1024M -jar minecraft_server.1.19.2.jar nogui


After downloading, you will get a .jar file. It is highly recommended to place this file in an empty folder, as the server program will release configuration files, making it easier to find them.



Open the command prompt by typing cmd in the directory and pressing Enter.




The official command name is fixed. You need to modify it to match the corresponding file name in the command. Here, my file is named server.jar.



Key Point: The server will exit here, but this is not due to an issue with your operation. You need to agree to a license agreement first.


Return to the folder, and you will find that the server program has created many new files. Find eula.txt, double-click to open it, and change false to true.

We run the server software again, and this is considered successful.

Linux


Ensure Java is installed on the Linux server. Some Linux systems may come with Java pre-installed. If you want to use the latest server version, it is highly recommended to install Java 17 or later, as a lower Java version may fail to start properly.

Linux: Portal



Download the server package file. You can download it on Windows first and then upload it to the Linux server, or use the wget command to download. It is highly recommended to place this file in an empty folder, as the server program will release configuration files, making it easier to find them.



Run the server using the command. The official command name is fixed, so you need to modify it to match the corresponding file name in the command. Here, my file is named server.jar.



Modify the eula.txt file. If the server does not have a graphical interface, it is recommended to use vim to edit. Enter the following command to edit:
vim eula.txt

After entering, it will not be possible to input text by default. Press i on the keyboard to activate input.
Change false to true.

Press ESC to exit the editing mode, then press :wq to save and exit.

Installing vim
If vim is not installed on the server, use the following commands to install it.
Ubuntu
apt-get install vim
CentOS
yum install vim


Run the server again.


If you are using an SSH connection to the Linux server, the SSH connection window cannot be closed. Once closed, the session ends, and the Minecraft server will also shut down.


First, enter stop to stop the server.


Installing screen
Ubuntu
apt-get install screen
CentOS
yum install screen


After installation, enter clear to clear the screen. This step is very important and must be executed.


Enter screen -R MC (Note: MC can be replaced with any word, pay attention to the case of R). After entering, it may take a while to display blank, and then it will automatically return to the original interface.


Start the server by entering the start command. After starting the server, you can close SSH.


Next time, enter screen -R MC to restore.




Connecting to the Server


Open the game and go to Multiplayer.



Both Direct Connection and Add Server can be used. Here, we will demonstrate adding a server. Since I am running the server locally, I enter the local address here. For cloud servers, please enter the server’s IP. If you modified the port, just add an English colon and then enter the port number.



Click Join on the created server.



About Configuration Files
Find the server.properties file in the directory and open it with Notepad. For specific configuration methods, you can refer to online resources.

title: Original Server Setup Guide for Minecraft Bedrock Edition (Mobile Version)
content:
Preface
Back then, I always played Minecraft in a local world. Later, I learned to play with classmates over a network, but every time we had to be on the same local network.
Later, I came across an app called “Minecraft Server Box,” which was my first time joining a server to play.
After that, I had an idea: to set up my own server to play.

Note: This tutorial is only applicable to the international mobile version and Win10 version of Minecraft. NetEase version cannot join this server.
Official Server
The purest and fastest-updated server, offering an authentic gaming experience, but it cannot load mods or plugins.
Server Configuration Guide
Windows Section


Search for minecraft on baidu, go to the Official Website | Minecraft, and make sure not to enter the Chinese version of the official website.



Scroll down to the bottom of the official website to find Support — Download.



Scroll down to find Experience Different Versions of MINECRAFT — Server Software — WINDOWS SERVER [ALPHA TEST VERSION].



On the download page, check the license agreement and click download.



After downloading, it is a compressed package. The directory structure after extraction looks like this.



Double-click bedrock_server.exe to run the server program. When it starts, it should look something like this. Pay attention to the highlighted areas in the image: one is the game version number, which must match the mobile version; the other is the port number, which you will enter when adding the server.



Connecting to the Server
Enter the server’s IP address on your mobile device, and you can start playing happily.


This demonstrates an internal network server. If you are using a public IP or cloud server, make sure to check both TCP and UDP when mapping ports. Bedrock Edition uses a different protocol than Java Edition, so please pay attention.

About Configuration Files
In the root directory of the server package, find the server.properties file and open it with Notepad.

For specific modification methods, you can search online or refer to the bedrock_server_how_to.html in the server package.

（Translated from Google Translate）

title: Minecraft Bedrock Edition (Mobile Version) Plugin Server Setup Guide
content:
Introduction
Initially, I played Minecraft in local worlds, but later learned to play with classmates in multiplayer mode, which required us to be on the same local network each time.
Later, I came across an app called “Minecraft Multiplayer Box,” which allowed me to join and play on servers for the first time.
After that, I had an idea: to set up my own server to play.

Note: This tutorial is only applicable to the international mobile version and Win10 version of Minecraft. The NetEase version cannot join this server.
Plugin Server

Nukkit is a high-performance, Java-based server for the Bedrock Edition.
Its structure is very similar to Bukkit/Spigot and is also written in Java.
It offers powerful multi-threading capabilities, allowing better utilization of your host resources to make the players’ gaming experience more enjoyable.
The source code is open under the LGPL license, making it easy for developers and server owners to learn and develop for Nukkit.
Nukkit adopts a structure similar to PocketMine-MP, providing efficient plugin solutions and fixes for various issues,
and it is also easy for everyone to contribute to Nukkit.


About One-Click Server Startup Script
I have prepared server packages for you here, all downloaded from the official website, suitable for both Windows and Linux.

File Description:


Nukkit-xxxxxxx.jar: Server startup file, runs based on Java.


Strat.bat/sh: One-click startup (I might have misspelled it, it should be start, so it’s like this, and the image can’t be changed).


update.bat/sh: Automatic server file update.


aria2c.exe: Windows download program, wget is used on Linux.


Download Links:


Minecraft Server Package (Linux): Link: https://pan.baidu.com/s/1FGNvVPoYn1vElEPsOHEmpg


Minecraft Server Package (Windows): Link: https://pan.baidu.com/s/1g9muEz324orZ1bsQtTS9Kw


Server Configuration Guide
Windows Section


Ensure that Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is installed on your computer or server. Follow the specific tutorial below:

Windows: Portal




Update the server files. Double-click the update.bat file to automatically update, which will use aria2 for downloading.



Start the server. Double-click the Strat.bat file to start the server with one click.
Alternatively, start using the command:
java -jar nukkit-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
Or
java -Xmxmaximum_memory -Xmsinitial_memory -jar nukkit*.jar


After startup, the first screen: Select a language, choose one you can understand, and press Enter to complete the settings.



On the second screen, the server is basically up and running. On subsequent runs, it will directly enter this screen.



Linux Section


Ensure that the Java environment is installed on your Linux server.

Linux: Portal

Or use the following command to install:
sudo apt-get updatesudo apt-get install openjdk-8-jre --fix-missing


Update the server files. Navigate to the server directory.

Enter the command
sh update.sh
If it cannot be executed, please grant it permissions.
chmod +777 ./update.sh
Here, wget is used. If you don’t have it, install it with the command
sudo apt-get install wget



Start the server. Use the command to start with one click:
sh Strat.sh
Or
java -jar nukkit-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
Or
java -Xmxmaximum_memory -Xmsinitial_memory -jar nukkit*.jar
If it cannot be executed, please grant it permissions.
chmod +777 ./Strat.sh


After startup, the first screen: Select a language, choose one you can understand, and press Enter to complete the settings.



On the second screen, the server is basically up and running. On subsequent runs, it will directly enter this screen.



Lock the server task (for SSH). First, enter stop to shut down the server.
Install screen with the command:
sudo apt-get install screen
After installation, enter clear to clear the screen. This step is very important and must be executed.
Then, enter screen -R MC (Note: MC can be replaced with any word, pay attention to the case of R).
It may take a while to go blank, and after it goes blank, it will automatically return to the original interface.
Then, start the server and enter the startup command.
After starting the server, you can close SSH.
Next time you start, enter screen -R MC to restore it.


Connecting to the Server
Here, we use the Win10 version of Minecraft for demonstration. The operation on the mobile version is the same.
Enter the game, click on servers, and then add a server.
You can customize the name, enter the server’s IP address, and if the port is not specified in the configuration file, leave it unchanged.
Click to play.


Regarding port forwarding, if it is a local server, you need a public IP address, then enter the router’s backend page, find port forwarding, and set it up. Here, note that you need to select both protocols. Previously, selecting only one protocol prevented connection, but after searching online, I learned that the Bedrock Edition works with multiple protocols, so selecting both will allow connection.

If it is a cloud server, go to the server’s management panel and open the security group.

About Configuration Files
Windows Section
Enter stop to stop the server.
You will find that many files have been added to the server’s running directory. Find the server.properties file and open it with Notepad.

The specific configuration method is left for you to search online.
Linux Section
Enter stop to stop the server.
You will find that many files have been added to the server’s running directory. Find the server.properties file and edit it with the command.
vi server.properties

The specific configuration method is left for you to search online.

title: Reverse Proxy under Nginx
content:
Preface
Recently, I was developing a project that used both Java’s Spring Boot and Python’s Flask. To ensure access under the same domain name, I used Nginx as a reverse proxy. It was relatively easy to configure when only one application was proxied, but with multiple applications, various interfaces started reporting errors. To prevent future pitfalls, I wrote this blog to document the most correct configuration.
The First Proxy
Main Application Interface
For applications developed with SpringBoot, pointing to the root directory of the domain name, proxy address http://127.0.0.1:9000。
location /{    proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:9000;;    proxy_set_header Host $host;    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;    proxy_set_header REMOTE-HOST $remote_addr;        add_header X-Cache $upstream_cache_status;        #Set Nginx Cache        	add_header Cache-Control no-cache;}
Static Files
If there is only one application, you can write it like this, it will only proxy files of the following formats.
location ~* \.(gif|png|jpg|css|js|woff|woff2)${	proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:9000;;    proxy_set_header Host $host;    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;    proxy_set_header REMOTE-HOST $remote_addr;    expires 12h;}
The Second Proxy
Backend Interface
This is an application developed with Flask, pointing to the /query directory, proxy address http://127.0.0.1:9099。
location ^~ /query{    proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:9099;;    proxy_set_header Host $host;    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;    proxy_set_header REMOTE-HOST $remote_addr;        add_header X-Cache $upstream_cache_status;        #Set Nginx Cache        	add_header Cache-Control no-cache;}
The preceding ^~ must be written, otherwise it can only point to the first level path of the proxy address, and the rest will not work at all.
Frontend Directory
There’s nothing much to say here, after setting the directory, it will automatically point to the index file.
location /app{    alias /www/your-path/app;}
If you have to say there’s a pitfall, see Difference between alias and root.
Frontend Static Files
Although it has been referenced to the root directory before, the static directory has not been referenced. If accessed, it will directly point to the first proxy program, so we also need to reference it again.
location ^~ /app/static/{    alias /www/your-path/app/assets/;}
The preceding ^~ must be written, otherwise accessing files will result in crazy 404s.
The Third Method
The first two methods work, but writing two feels a bit redundant. The frontend static files and static files are actually together, so we can merge them into one.
location ^~ /app/{    alias /www/your-path/app/;}
Adding / after specifying the directory can directly guide to the entire folder.
Load Balancing
Load Address
If you’re afraid that a service will go down and want to have a more stable service, you can deploy the application on two servers simultaneously and use Nginx for load balancing.
upstream fzjh {	server 127.0.0.1:5000 weight=2;	server 127.0.0.1:5000 weight=1;}location /{    proxy_pass http://fzjh;;    proxy_set_header Host zxwS;    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;    proxy_set_header REMOTE-HOST $remote_addr;        add_header X-Cache $upstream_cache_status;        #Set Nginx Cache        	add_header Cache-Control no-cache;}
weight represents the weight, theoretically, the higher the weight, the greater the chance of being assigned to that server.
Static Files
Store a static resource on the Nginx server and use the following line of code to guide it.
location  ~* \.(gif|png|jpg|css|js|woff|woff2)${    root /www/your-path/static;}
Difference between alias and root
alias
location /static/{    alias /www/your-path/static/;}
In this case, Nginx will automatically go to the /www/your-path/static/ directory to find files.
root
location /static/{    root /www/your-path/static/;}
In this case, Nginx will automatically go to the /www/your-path/static/static/ directory to find files, meaning it adds an extra layer.

title: Running the Unipus College Foreign Language Teaching Platform on Windows 10 or Windows 11
content:
Introduction
As is well known, Internet Explorer 11 was discontinued on June 15, 2022. This day has not only arrived but has long since passed. The latest Windows 10 and Windows 11 systems have entirely replaced the system-level Edge browser, rendering Internet Explorer unusable.

Although the times are progressing and most websites are well-compatible with new browsers, there are some holdouts (I won’t name them here, but the Unipus College Foreign Language Teaching Platform is one such site) that only support the IE browser. This has led to the creation of this article: Running the Unipus College Foreign Language Teaching Platform on Windows 10 or Windows 11.

Method 1: A Bit of a Hack
This method was taught to us by our teachers: right-click on this title and open it in a new tab.

The principle behind this is quite simple. By inspecting the source code, it’s not hard to find that it has already defined a link for redirection in this tab, which the browser can recognize and navigate to a new page. However, it also defines an IE browser detection function, and if it’s not an IE browser, it won’t redirect.

However:

This old system is actually Flash-based!!! As everyone knows, Chrome and Edge no longer support Flash plugins. If your computer already has a Flash plugin installed, you can consider installing an older version of Chrome or Firefox. The software download section of the Unipus College Foreign Language Teaching Platform has these options.
But this tutorial is based on the IE browser, so there’s no need to look further if you’re using other browsers.

Method 2: Enable Edge’s IE Compatibility Mode


Click the three dots in the upper right corner of Edge and go to Settings.



Find Default browser on the right side, change Allow to reload websites in Internet Explorer mode (IE mode) to Allow, and then restart the browser.



After restarting, click the three dots in the upper right corner and select Reload in Internet Explorer mode.



Once the icon shown in the figure appears, we log in again.



After logging in, we click the course link. We still get an error pop-up. Don’t hurry, keep reading.



Right-click on this title (this is the IE right-click menu, different from Edge) and open it in a new tab.



It will prompt us to install a Flash plugin. At this point, we should not click to install, as this Flash is default for Windows 7 and will fail to install on Windows 10.




For specific Flash installation methods, refer to:

Flash Installation Tutorial



After installing Flash, most pages should now be visible.



If some pages still don’t display properly, refer to the follow-up work:

Plugin and Font Library Installation
LearnX Voice Recognition and Recording Plugin




Method 3: VMware Virtual Machine with Windows 7
The Windows 7 system comes with the IE browser by default. We can use an old Windows 7 computer to run it. If you don’t have a Windows 7 computer handy, you can install it in a virtual machine.
1. Install VMware Virtual Machine


Search for vmware on baidu and go to the VMware official website.



Find Resources in the upper right corner.



Scroll down to Product Downloads.



In the search box, type vmware workstation pro 16 and click the small magnifying glass to search.



After searching, click the second one, as the first one is for Linux, and the second one is for Windows. Note that the official website’s labeling isn’t very clear, so pay attention.



Click into it, and you’ll see the installer in the file list. Click Download Now to download.

Downloading from the official website requires logging in with an account. Here, I provide a backup link.


The downloaded file is a .exe file. Double-click to install.



Click Next.



Accept the license agreement.



If you have installed Hyper-V, you may see this option. To ensure compatibility, check Automatically install WHP.



Don’t change anything on this step, just click Next.



It’s recommended to uncheck both boxes.



Click Next.



Click Install.




After installation, click Finish.



2. Activate the Software


Open the VMware virtual machine software.



Select I have a license key for VMware Workstation 16, enter your purchased key, and click Continue to activate.




3. Create a Virtual Machine


Click Create a new virtual machine on the main interface.



Select Typical, then click Next.



Here, select Install operating system later, as if we choose the system image here, VMware will automatically deploy it for us. However, the system deployed afterward is quite poor, so we’ll do it manually.



Select Windows 7 for the operating system.



Set the name and storage location for the virtual machine. It’s highly recommended to place the virtual machine in a disk other than the C drive.



For the disk capacity, fill in according to your needs. It should not be less than 20GB to reserve some space for the system.



Click Customize hardware at this step.



Find the New CD/DVD option, click Use ISO image file, and select your ISO image file. Here is the download link for the Windows 7 64-bit Professional with sp1 bulk edition. It’s recommended to use Xunlei for downloading (make sure to choose the version with vl, otherwise the activation will be a nightmare).
ed2k://|file|cn_windows_7_professional_with_sp1_vl_build_x64_dvd_u_677816.iso|3266004992|5A52F4CCEFA71797D58389B397038B2F|/



For the Network Adapter, it’s recommended to change it to Bridged Mode, but it doesn’t really matter if you don’t change it.



After closing the Hardware Settings page, click Finish.



Click Power on this virtual machine on the newly created virtual machine.



Wait for the virtual machine to start.



4. Install the Operating System


Select the language you understand and click Next – Install now.




Accept the license terms.



Select Custom (Advanced).



On the disk selection page, click Driver options (Advanced) (A).



Select the unallocated disk, click New, Apply, and then OK.





Click Next, and the system will install automatically. Just wait for it to finish. You can use this time to have a cup of coffee.




After several restarts, the virtual machine will enter the system settings page. Set a username you like, then click Next all the way. You can choose to set or not set a password. As for updates, we’ll discuss it later. Just follow the images for the rest.








Enter the operating system.



5. Install VMware Tools


Click Virtual Machine in the menu bar and select Install VMware Tools.



If there’s an autorun window, click Run.

If no window pops up, find the DVD drive in This PC and double-click it.



The installation process is straightforward—just click Next.






If there are driver issues, select Always install this driver software.



If you encounter the following error, refer to VMware Tools Error Handling.



After installation, restart the system once.




The benefit of installing VMware Tools is that the resolution can adapt automatically, and you can also directly drag and drop files into the virtual machine.



Using Unipus Platform with IE8


Open the Internet Explorer browser that comes with Windows 7 (the system default is IE8).



When selecting courses, it still prompts Compatibility View Issues.



Click Tools in the menu bar and select Compatibility View, and the page will refresh and open in compatibility view.



After entering the course, nothing happens. There is a Flash Player add-on here, but don’t click it, as it won’t do anything useful.



In the menu bar, you can see Software Download. We find the Flash Player suitable for IE browsers.



Run it directly.



Check the license terms and install.



After installation, it should work normally.



If some pages still don’t display properly, refer to the follow-up work:

Plugin and Font Library Installation
LearnX Voice Recognition and Recording Plugin




Using Unipus Platform with IE11
Since Windows 7 defaults to IE8, we need to manually upgrade to IE11.


Search for Internet Explorer11 download on baidu and find Download Internet Explorer 11 (Offline Installer) - Microsoft Support.



On the new page, find Internet Explorer Download Center.



Choose the first Internet Explorer 11 for Windows7 64-bit.



For the language, select Simplified Chinese, then click the Download button on the right to download.

Backup link




After downloading, it’s an .exe file. Double-click to install it.



Click Next and wait for the installation to complete.




After installation, you need to restart the computer once to use it normally.



When selecting courses, it still prompts Compatibility View Issues.



Find the small gear in the upper right corner and select Compatibility View Settings (B).



Add this website to Compatibility View Settings.



After that, you can open the course normally.



If some pages still don’t display properly, refer to the follow-up work:

Plugin and Font Library Installation
LearnX Voice Recognition and Recording Plugin



Flash Installation Tutorial (Provided by Tian Yuan on Zhihu)
Don’t try to download and install the Flash for the Unipus platform, as you’ll find it impossible to install. Follow my steps to install it step by step.
Method 1: Clean Flash Player (Recommended)
This is a modified version based on the Chinese version, removing ads and malicious software, and offering a simple installation interface with one-click setup.


Clean Flash with Standalone Player Download


Backup link



You can find the latest version of the Installer on GitLab.
After downloading, proceed with the installation, following the illustrations and your personal preferences.


Agree to the terms.



Choose the version to install.



Whether to install the local player, i.e., the swf player.



Whether to install the Debug version.



Install.




Installation complete.



Method 2: Chinese Version Download (Provided by Tian Yuan on Zhihu)
Adobe’s official page no longer provides Flash downloads, advising everyone to uninstall Flash and to be cautious of malicious software on third-party download sources. However, Adobe and Chongqing Chongcheng Network Technology Co., Ltd. have provided a “special edition” FlashPlayer for domestic users.

Flash Player Official Download Center - Flash China Official Website

Here’s a quick explanation:



Version
Compatible Browsers




Flash Center
Built-in browser or select the version to install in software


ActiveX version
IE browser


PPAPI version
Google Chrome or Chromium-based browsers


NPAPI version
Firefox



We need to download the ActiveX version. Note: This is a modified version with ads and malicious software.

After downloading, proceed with the installation.


Plugin and Font Library Installation
About Pepperservice
Pepperservice is a terminal speech evaluation service software that allows learners to practice speaking and receive feedback even without an internet connection. It’s recommended to install it before starting your learning to make the process more flexible and convenient.
Installation


Download and run the installer pepper_setup.exe, click Next according to the prompts, and install.

Windows version：Download link 1    Backup link
Mac version：Download link 1   Backup link



Click Next.



Accept the agreement.



Click Next all the way.





Install.



Run it, and the program doesn’t have a main interface; it only generates an icon in the lower right corner. Since this is a service-based software, remember to allow it through the firewall.





If you want to test it, visit http://127.0.0.1:5768/chivoxapi-js/v3.0/Examples/aipanel_enword.html，同样使用IE兼容模式打开，并同意麦克风权限。



LearnX Voice Recognition and Recording Plugin
About LearnX
Learnx is a voice recognition plugin developed in Japan. If the user plays a disc, such as for learning New Horizon English, it will be used. Learning the online courses of New Horizon English also requires this plugin.
Installation


Download and run the installer LearnX_Setup20110505.exe. You can choose any folder to store the downloaded files.

Windows version：Download link 1   Backup link



After installation, nothing happens. Restart the browser.




VMware Tools Error Handling
Encountering the following error during installation is due to driver installation issues.

The installer cannot automatically install the Virtual Machine Communication Interface Sockets (VSock) driver. This driver must be manually installed.

This is the explanation from VMware’s official website.

Essentially, it means that Windows 7 is too old and no longer receives updates, as VMware Tools use the latest code signing, which the old version cannot support.
Solution


Download the patch package kb4474419.

Download link：Official address   Backup address

Choose the Windows 7 version and click the Download button on the right.

On the new page, we also need to click once more to start downloading.



After downloading, it’s an .msu file. Double-click to run it.



Click Yes to install.




After installation, restart the computer once.



After restarting, reinstall VMware Tools.

title: No Computer at Home? Teach You to Write Python Programs on Your Phone
content:
This tutorial will teach you how to run Python programs on your Android and iOS devices.

Android Section

Or copy the link below
https://www.coolapk.com/apk/ru.iiec.pydroid3

title: Connecting to MySQL Database with PHP
content:
Introduction
Sometimes we need to use PHP to perform operations on a MySQL database. This article will explain how to use PHP to connect to a MySQL database.
Connecting to the Database
The following content can be directly written into the main PHP file or as a separate file.
$mysql_server_name = '127.0.0.1';$mysql_username = 'root';$mysql_password = '123456';$mysql_database = 'sjk';$conn = mysqli_connect($mysql_server_name, $mysql_username, $mysql_password, $mysql_database);// Error message for database connection failureif (mysqli_connect_errno($conn)) {     echo "<script>alert('Unable to connect to the database')</script>";    exit();}mysqli_query($conn, "set names utf8"); // Database encoding formatmysqli_set_charset($conn, "utf8"); // Set default client character set.
Executing SQL Statements
Query (write all contents from the database into the $data array).
$sql = "SELECT 姓名 FROM `G2022`";$result = mysqli_query($conn, $sql);$data = array();while ($row = mysqli_fetch_array($result)) {    array_push($data, $row);}

title: Program Flow and Sequential Structure in Java Programming
content:
Program Flow and Sequential Structure
Flow

The order in which statements are executed when a program runs.

Flow control statements are used to control the execution order of statements in a program.
Structured programming design specifies three basic flow structures:

Sequential Structure
Branch (Selection) Structure
Loop Structure

I. Statements

Simple Statements

End with ;, representing an action to be executed, which can be assignment, judgment, or jump, etc.


Compound Statements

A block of statements enclosed in {}, generally consisting of multiple statements.



II. Sequential Structure

The sequential structure is the simplest of the basic control structures. In the sequential structure, program statements are executed in the order they are written.

No need for special flow control statements
Write statements in the desired execution order

title: Submitting a Website Link to Baidu Webmaster via PHP
content:
Many webmasters dream of having their websites indexed by well-known engines like Baidu. Here, Baidu provides the Baidu Webmaster tool for submitting your website, and it also offers an API interface that allows programs to automatically submit website page URLs.
Code
The official Baidu Webmaster also provides PHP version code, which this code optimizes and improves upon the Baidu code.
$site = "Website Address";$token = "Baidu Webmaster Token";$urls = array() // All page addresses must be in this array$api = "http://data.zz.baidu.com/urls?site=$site&token=$token";$ch = curl_init();$options =  array(    CURLOPT_URL => $api,    CURLOPT_POST => true,    CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,    CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => implode("\n", $urls),    CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array('Content-Type: text/plain'),);curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);$result = curl_exec($ch);curl_close($ch);$success = json_decode($result)->success;if($success){    echo "Push Successful";}else{    echo "Push Failed";}
For specific return information, refer to Baidu Webmaster.
